page.title: 02WALES VILLAGE
page.content: The population is growing here due to new housing.Wales was once a mining village.Now most of the pits have closed down and there are lots of different jobs.A few people own shops or work at the school.The shopping facilities have had little change.They are still quite poor.Nearly everyone owns a car or even 2.There are more buses now as well.They run on the main road.Just a few years ago the motorway was built in place of the cricket field. Rother Valley Park has been built very recently.It is just on the edge of Wales.It was open-cast coal land and farmland before the park was built and Bedgreave mill was working.The Park covers over 287 hectares of land & it took about 6 years to complete.
